item.title: Dragon Armor
item.dc:creator: @koolgordon koolgordon
item.description:
@koolgordon wrote:

Senorlemon,
If you use a plain Devolution based server then just go to item.java
do CRTL + F and then in the search thing search for legs and it’ll come up with something,
then add the item ID under there.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Armor
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Draco Owner Draco
item.description:
@Owner_Draco wrote:

Senorlemon, Go to Item.java in your Server files and search legs, Then under that you should see a long list of codes, then what you do is type the id of your item in there so it blends in with the othres, do the same In item4.java

Read full topic

Not ::add models
Not add models 14001

Just
add models

item.title: Dragon Armor
item.dc:creator: @ak226688 ak226688
item.description:
@ak226688 wrote:

[quote=“senorlemon, post:1, topic:270651”]i did a recolor of the dragon legs i converted them into a mqo recolored them in meseq then i turned them into a .dat with priorities set at 10 in rs model viewer then i used 7zip to make them .gz then i added them into my models folder. and i must have had a failed attempt at the ints because i still get a null when i use the item number for a pickup. the item number is 14500 and the model numbers are 14000 for the drop and inv. 14001 for the female wear and 14002 for the male wear. could someone please make me an int? i will post what my int is and you can tell me what to change. i had to change the model name to accomodate the server so it isnt 25001,25002, and 25003 anymore its 14000,14001,and 14002. my client is a 317 and im really frustrated about this. i have followed every guide to the letter. my int is in class8.java. if it needs to be at the end or something thats fine but i just put it where all the other items were i didnt think it would matter. PLEASE HELP ME. thank you.
here is my int.

if(i == 14500) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt174 = 14000;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.anInt181 = 1000;
class8.anInt190 = 470;
class8.anInt198 = 129;
class8.anInt169 = -1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt165 = 14002;
class8.anInt200 = 14001;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = “God of War Legs”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Worn by the God of War.”.getBytes();
}[/quote] did you do “add model [model id]”

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon Armor
item.dc:creator: @senorlemon senorlemon
item.description:
@senorlemon wrote:

i did a recolor of the dragon legs i converted them into a mqo recolored them in meseq then i turned them into a .dat with priorities set at 10 in rs model viewer then i used 7zip to make them .gz then i added them into my models folder. and i must have had a failed attempt at the ints because i still get a null when i use the item number for a pickup. the item number is 14500 and the model numbers are 14000 for the drop and inv. 14001 for the female wear and 14002 for the male wear. could someone please make me an int? i will post what my int is and you can tell me what to change. i had to change the model name to accomodate the server so it isnt 25001,25002, and 25003 anymore its 14000,14001,and 14002. my client is a 317 and im really frustrated about this. i have followed every guide to the letter. my int is in class8.java. if it needs to be at the end or something thats fine but i just put it where all the other items were i didnt think it would matter. PLEASE HELP ME. thank you.
here is my int.

if(i == 14500) {
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wear”;
class8.anInt174 = 14000;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.anInt181 = 1000;
class8.anInt190 = 470;
class8.anInt198 = 129;
class8.anInt169 = -1;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt165 = 14002;
class8.anInt200 = 14001;
class8.anInt204 = 28;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = “God of War Legs”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “Worn by the God of War.”.getBytes();
}
